intro: Acer kweilinense, commonly known as the Kweilin maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in clusters before the leaves emerge in spring. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
